completion:
Filters a table to the subset of rows that satisfy a predicate. Syntax: T | where Predicate Example: StormEvents
| project DamageProperty, EventType, BeginLocation, EndLocation
| where DamageProperty > 0
    and EventType == "Flood"
    and BeginLocation != EndLocation END

Takes two or more tables and returns the rows of all of them. Syntax: [ T | ] union [ UnionParameters ] [kind= inner|outer] [withsource= ColumnName] [isfuzzy= true|false]. Example:  Query
| where Timestamp > ago(1d)
| union withsource=SourceTable kind=outer 
   (Command | where Timestamp > ago(1d))
| summarize dcount(UserId) END
